We have issued a severe #flood warning for #EastDidsbury #WestDidsbury and #Northenden which means a threat to life and significant disruption. 
We are working with the emergency services to keep communities to keep people safe. Updates ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/uGQ4g6RGOV https://t.co/Ue0KEP0snL

‚ö†Ô∏è @gmpolice & @EnvAgencyNW have announced a Severe Flood Warning covering parts of Didsbury, Chorlton & Northenden as levels of the River Mersey rise. ‚ö†Ô∏è 

A Severe Flood Warning means we must act now & evacuations have started, focusing on those most vulnerable first.

urls.title: Warrington floods in pictures as snow arrives in town!
urls.description: PICTURES: AFTER a day of flooding problems across the town, Warrington was hit with a surprise snow flurry on Wednesday evening, to add to the problems.

tweets.text: A round-up of pictures as floods and snow hit #Warrington https://t.co/hh5o0fj6yT https://t.co/vsPK67k42I
#StormChristoph currently 2 @EnvAgencyYNE flood warnings & 3 alerts in place for #Leeds. Keep updated and informed at https://t.co/FjsUnQcPZe #PrepareActSurvive

@dinahkeal @YWHelp @NortonOnDerwent @RyedaleDC @EnvAgencyYNE High time Ryedale District Council prosecuted Yorkshire Water for failing to upgrade the Malton and Norton sewerage system and for allowing the escape of sewage. Sewer flooding is a criminal offence!! @MikeKemp3 @joncowap @CathyReports @CarlaFowler @IMcMillan @elizacarthy
@YWHelp - another pump is needed at Church Street @NortonOnDerwent Flood waters are rising into the road and at entrance St Nicholas Street car park @RyedaleDC @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/YQudsfJ5zc

üö®Incident Updateüö®

The @EnvAgencyYNE are nearing the trigger to use #RotherRegulators which protect property through @RMBCPress & @MyDoncaster.

River levels on the Rother have meant that #TeamEA & RMBC have deployed #HVP‚Äôs to #Catcliffe which pump water away from homes. https://t.co/4EFeaHHucS

The River Loxley at ‚ÄòRowell Bridge level recorder‚Äô a few minutes ago. Swollen, turbulent, angry and still rising. Fingers crossed for the folk downstream of all this! You can check the river level every 15 minutes via @EnvAgency site here: https://t.co/5yC1Z9nYMZ https://t.co/PiN8KzH8fd

Some intense rainfall over West Mids this evening on our radars (pink on the picture).  Worst of the rain will clear about midnight, don't be surprised if you see a bit of snow either..but do stay up to date with Flood Warnings from @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/nz681AdVjq https://t.co/pOr3wLooRG

Extreme weather means flooding throughout Warrington North, with peak floods expected in the early hours of the morning. I'm liaising with the local authority and the emergency services about affected areas.

Please stay indoors where you can and follow @EnvAgencyNW for updates. https://t.co/P3M8WX3tsQ

tweets.text: We are experiencing issues with the forecast model data displayed on our https://t.co/u5YnaL7y4i page along the #RiverSevern in #Shropshire. The correct forecast levels for #WelshBridge in #Shrewsbury are 4.1m to 4.5m which is more in line with normal winter flooding levels.

It‚Äôs wet, wet, wet across the #Midlands today (Wednesday). Lots of surface water on roads. Please don‚Äôt drive through #flood water. 30cms is enough to float your car. Keep checking your #flood risk. Latest update here 
https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/fMneKq3b7w

Our #FieldTeam from @EnvAgencyYNE have today installed some temporary barrier along the #RiverDon in #Doncaster.

This barrier protects an access route to one of the #Covid19 vaccination centres.

It‚Äôs a precautionary measure in case the forecast worsens. https://t.co/IHErO1V8Y8

Issuing severe #flood warnings is always hard as we know what it means for many people. Sadly @EnvAgencyNW have had to issue 1 for #Maghull #Merseyside This means there is risk to life / serious disruption. Pls follow advice. #BeSafe #StormCristoph #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/SfbR2HUxQH

@shandy_defender @EnvAgencyYNE Ha, very small world then.....  I was at Bentley too üòÇ

Nice Geodesign barrier there, we‚Äôve got some of that same stuff üëäüèΩ https://t.co/PHNhJ7FX2K

Now a lot of snow falling in  Manchester. It's going to be a tough night for those impacted by flooding and working to help. Thoughts with all those affected. #StormChristoph
@EnvAgency https://t.co/AsxnZWcAqE

Please follow advice and stay safe, @DerbyshireFRS are working with all partner agencies to try and safely manage the situation @DerbysPolice @Derbyshirecc @DerbyCC @EnvAgency and many others https://t.co/zXkvsextGy

Severe #flood warnings have been issued in parts of Greater #Manchester as #StormChristoph brings more rain.
 
Find out more: https://t.co/pSJIL5Vlfz

Our thoughts are with @EnvAgency staff and other Cat 1 & 2 responders, voluntary organisations and community #volunteers responding to the impact of #StormChristoph and the communities that lie in its path. A very difficult start to 2021 but we look towards brighter times.
Please use https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 to get the latest information. #FloodWarnings #Floodaware

More heavy rain is forecast overnight. Don‚Äôt take any unnecessary risks ‚Äì always avoid flood water. Check the flood risk in your area:  

https://t.co/xNlgwQ9Q4z 

#StormChristoph #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/xHzsaCyYwu

We have been bolstering the repairs we are currently making to Temple Manor wash lands in the Lower Aire today, as they fill up due to snowmelt and rainfall. Stay #floodaware and check the flood warnings where you live https://t.co/3UGLsuUejh

urls.title: Flood warnings for England - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text:
#StormChristoph has led to high river levels across the country. Stay safe at home ‚Äì if you do need to head out, don‚Äôt take any unnecessary risks. Check your flood risk before you leave: https://t.co/xNlgwQ9Q4z 

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/NoJbBteLiZ

UPDATE: 7.30pm: Wet & windy day @EnvAgencyYNE @Calderdale defences tested, river & canal been high. Amber warning remains in place, but stabilising & levels reducing. Warning ICE from 0100 as rains ease. Outstanding effort #teamcalderdale inc @slowtheflow_UK #StormChristoph üôè

UPDATE: We now have two more SEVERE FLOOD WARNINGS - Maghull, Merseyside - this means a risk to life - please heed advice from emergency services - detail here https://t.co/gU32XatmKj Stay safe all #StormCristoph #floodaware https://t.co/egCzcpZLgH

We have 14 #flood warnings in place across Greater Manchester and Cheshire this afternoon. This means flooding is expected and immediate action is required

Check your risk and sign up for flood warnings: https://t.co/r0eYwgfghj https://t.co/JDTUFhoa1j

Due to the flooding & it‚Äôs widespread & impactful nature a Major Incident for Derbyshire has been declared. Multi Agency operation in operation - not made easier because of C19. My thanks to all dedicated staff & workers across all services involved. Stay safe & heed warnings. https://t.co/lNJ02gNhFG
@adrianandkim @Calderdale @ScottAPatient Our Council can't even develop a plan to bid into the ¬£200m! You know this as we have discussed this several times
@RogersSian @Calderdale @EnvAgencyYNE @Tod_Flood_Group Plague of locusts tomorrow üòÇ
@RogersSian @Calderdale @EnvAgencyYNE @Tod_Flood_Group On a serious note @RogersSian it‚Äôs all fine right now üôåüèª

tweets.text: River levels in Calderdale are still responding to current rainfall and will remain high in the upper parts of the catchment. We continue to monitor the situation . Stay #floodaware and check flood warnings in your area https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/aW7k7fp5PE

üåßÔ∏è Keep up to date with the latest #FloodWarnings and #FloodAlerts - check your flood risk and sign up for free flood warnings: https://t.co/dnn62eEeLZ

Follow @EnvAgencyNW & @TheFloodHub  for updates #LancsAlert #StormChristoph https://t.co/PhmxZLnc5U

@Calderdale @HalfpennyKerry @floodmary @mrsk3r @slowtheflow_UK @CalderdaleFound @FloodDigitalEA @EnvAgencyYNE @EnvAgencyNW @EnvAgency @johncurtinEA @mpsinstltd @MeganClinch @ScottAPatient @BBCNWT @BBCLookNorth @SCcrowther @DefraGovUK https://t.co/1Bo3O4LrlI

tweets.text: Shout out to all MCC staff and our partners working flat out through the night on the frontline to help our most vulnerable residents in unprecedented conditions @EnvAgencyNW @gmpolice @manchesterfire #StormChristoph https://t.co/jemx7nqUTC

Here's some great work by the @EnvAgencyMids team to prevent homes near #Retford #Beck from flooding as #StormChristoph is expected to bring heavy rain. Make sure you are #floodaware and sign up for flood warnings ‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/yThWn87xTB
@charlotte2153 @EnvAgencyNW The drains can't seem to cope you can see the water coming back up. Parts of Orford already closed off with sandbags being put down.

The @metofficeEMids and @EnvAgencyMids have issued #FloodAlerts for areas of #Bassetlaw, including #Worksop & #Retford, as a result of Storm Christoph. This will bring heavy & persistent rainfall between now & Thursday morning. Read our latest news ‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏è

tweets.text: Significant snow fall now adding to problems in #Warrington.  To report flooding the @EnvAgency has a 24 hour incident hotline on 0800 80 70 60. Aware of further flood warnings in #Lymm and an liaising with @WarringtonBC #StormChristoph https://t.co/gGbsaB4su1
